list_definition.definition: the act of enlarging or state of being enlarged

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Enlargement of the glands in the neck is usually a sign of illness.

list_ex_of_english: Fifteen applications for new holdings and eight for enlargements have been received.
The price at which holdings needing alteration will be sold cannot be given before the alteration, enlargements, or improvements are carried out.
There are 100 new schools actually being built at this moment and 350 enlargements going on.
At least it must be remembered that between these periods 5,500 odd acres were given off to settlers, either as enlargements or in other ways.
I should like to use this opportunity to state my position concerning future enlargements.
Would not this social model be damaged by enlargements that did not take account of it?
The doctrine of judicial precedent has enabled all sorts of amendments, amplifications and enlargements to be grafted on.
The whole cost of improving and repairing playgrounds and playing-fields, including enlargements, falls on the ratepayers.
